website_summaries.verdict: Durable and water resistant with good traction, these well-fitted boots are a great choice for active dogs.
pros: Sturdy, good quality material that lasts for months, owners note
Dogs are able to wear boots comfortably all day
cons: Boot sizes run about a half-size too large, owners report
May slide off paws of short-haired dogs
Some owners note dogs with dew claws experience irritation when wearing boots

customer_reviews.title: They definitely look cool, but there is no padding inside the shoe ...
customer_reviews.text: They definitely look cool, but there is no padding inside the shoe where their paws go. The inside is like raw hide that rubs their paws every step. My pup probably walked 5mins an every step she bit at her paws. I at first I though it was because they were new to her but then I took them off and found the reason. We bought these for a hike on the hot sunny rocks in Arizona and Utah while hiking Zion and she rather have no shoes on. I would not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Got the socks for better fit like they suggested did the same exact thing ...
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 50lb mutt that chases me on my mountain bike after she tore her pads on the rocky trails in socal a few times. Did the exact opposite of what I was hoping for and rubbed the tops of her pads raw until they bled 1/2 mile into the ride. Got the socks for better fit like they suggested did the same exact thing after a mile bled through the socks and booties.
customer_reviews.author: will

customer_reviews.title: Love them!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! Love the color and seems like it's well made. Definitely pull the Velcro tight so they won't fall off. For reference I bought the 1.5 in one for my 12 lb cockapoo
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Nishimura

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY IF YOUR DOG HAS DEW CLAWS
customer_reviews.text: I have a service dog and in the summer he has to wear boots to protect his feet. I know many handlers that recommended these boots so I decided to buy them. The reason I am giving this such a high review is because they were made well and I think they could hold up for a very long time, but DO NOT BUY if your dog has dew claws. My poor baby's claws were bloodied after three hours of wearing them. You also have to buy the socks. It is necessary or if your dog has "SLIGHTLY" sensitive feet it will rub.
customer_reviews.author: Customer in Texas

customer_reviews.title: Sizing is off
customer_reviews.text: Tuffwear shoes are great, I was replacing my size 2.5 - when theses arrived they were HUGE and labeled 2.5. I remeasured to be sure 2.5 is my dog’s size. I wrote supplier about dissatisfaction and got no response. I donated them to my nonprofit service dog trainer.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Not for our dog...
customer_reviews.text: My dog absolutely could not get used to wearing these. She looked really miserable and her normal instant response to commands turned into repeating myself two or three times just to get her attention. We sized up thinking the first set was too small but she still did the alien walk after weeks of daily use. They are also not in any way water resistant. Her poor little paws were soaked after being out in the rain on a several hour trip. The only way we will ever use anything like this again is if we have to do city walking where she might get blistered from hot pavement. Absolutely never again otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Kaine

customer_reviews.title: Protect your Kiddo
customer_reviews.text: My Mal took right to them, no high stepping trying to shake them. Very well built. 4 stars because they could come up just a little higher. His dew claws slip out when he is running hard in them but he is powerful in sprinting so other breeds may not have this problem. I have noticed I can tighten them down more and it seems to help contain them but I am not sure how comfortable that is for him. They fit accurately and I highly recommend them over other paw protection options out there for your kiddo as I have tried them. They are a must in hot weather and rough terrain conditions.
customer_reviews.author: realreviews

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the pooch
customer_reviews.text: We live in a desert climate and have two young Great Danes that do not like to stay inside all summer. NOt to mention, living in Palm Springs, CA where just about everyplace is dog-friendly, we like to go out to downtown in the evenings for ice cream or to the weekly street fair. These let us take our kids out with us and not worry about feet getting too hot. Yes, it takes time for them to adjust to them, but just like anything else, patience and training is key. Anyone who likes to take their dogs out in urban environments should own a pari fo shoes for their pooch!
customer_reviews.author: BadBear

customer_reviews.title: These don't stay on.
customer_reviews.text: I have an elderly Cocker Spaniel whose back legs are now crossing and he can't stand up easily. I was psyched when I found these on Amazon. So, I got one set for his back legs. He is not a fan but I knew I could get him used to them. However, when he gets up, they twist around and shortly fall off. With all the fluff on a Cocker's feet, I know it's probably from not getting tight enough. I got them for inside the house so he could get up easily but I don't want to cut off his circulation. So, it is a conundrum, isn't it?
customer_reviews.author: VT Lady

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, fit will, dog approves
customer_reviews.text: My dog instantly took to these and does not object to using them. They fit on snug and don't fall off. I used the size guide and it worked perfectly. They are very durable, rugged and will work across the board for all situations that we encounter. We live in Arizona, so they are sturdy enough to protect against cactus needles and the heat. He also sometimes gets sore nails and this protects his nails to keep them from scraping and bleeding on the sidewalks. Have not yet tried them walking on the beach, but that seems perfectly doable - they are snug enough where I don't think they would be sucked off in the mud flats.
customer_reviews.author: NKL

customer_reviews.title: These help my old Doberman keep her balance.
customer_reviews.text: Okay. It only took ordering nearly one of every size to get a pair that fit Picklepodapus (aka, old Dobie). Shoe shopping is difficult online but with the shutdown for Covid, online was the only choice. One shining day, the pair that fit arrived! It took a giggle-inducing five minutes for her to get used to the shoes. The soles grip our tile floor nicely and she no longer falls because her hind legs slide out behind her. She wears them on our walks and this prevents her feet from dragging across the ground and getting scraped. If you have an older dog, you might find these to be helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Erzsebet Carmean

customer_reviews.title: Thumbs Down!
customer_reviews.text: I tried 2 different sizes payed shipping to get the first set exchanged for a smaller size. The botties are expensive yet they cause sores on my dogs paws. They are the right size and fit. Just too many issues for the $$$
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Desperate for doggy shoes for my Maltese, who LOVES to go on long walks but whose paw pads can't take the asphalt in our neighborhood, I bought these pricey shoes. This is our 5th pair of doggy shoes. They STAYED ON for the most part, which was a first, and protected his feet, which was nice. It's not easy to get them on tight enough to stay put without making sore spots on his legs, but I think that's user error and no fault of the shoes themselves. So far, these are my favorites.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy M

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome and fit my pups perfectly
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome and fit my pups perfectly, although it is funny watching them walk around in them for the first time. Bought these for biking since the road, especially in the summer mornings in Phoenix, AZ, is still pretty warm and my dogs' pads were getting tore up from running daily. These fit nice and don't fall off often. My two pitbulls LOVE running when we bike and we usually go average 12 mph over several miles and these rarely fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Shay Harding

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my girl with hip arthritis
customer_reviews.text: My baby girl is doing so well with these! She’s lost muscle in her back legs due to her arthritis in her hips. Got these because her little back paws were sliding all over the place. These are amazing....she’s got the grip she needs to give her confidence around the house while she goes through physical therapy and hopefully gets her strength back. She got used to them instantly as I only put them on her back feet. The only mild complaint I have is that they spin around on her paws periodically and you need to fix them. She is a 65 pound boxer. Would recommend to all breeds!
customer_reviews.author: Corinna

customer_reviews.title: NOT for Giant Breeds!
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t even begin to hold on for longer than one minute. Needs to be much higher up on the leg, it barely touches the ankles on my Great Dane. NOT for giant breeds!
customer_reviews.author: David McCallister

customer_reviews.title: These boots protect my pups feet from harsh street salts.
customer_reviews.text: These are great shoes for my pup. They were sized as expected. However, I have mixed feelings about the product which is why I'm taking away one star. They are great for protecting her feet from the salts on our heavily treated streets which is their main purposes... but cause her slip on black ice. To be fair... my shoes/boots would slip without crampons. Therefore, we try to walk/run in the deep powder snow after crossing the streets and she loves running with these... but they are a pain to find if/when they fall off.
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Something that actually helps my 13 year old dog
customer_reviews.text: My dog is almost 13. He weighs about 100lbs and has started falling a few times a day, especially on wood and linoleum. We tried pads that stick to his feet but they fell off constantly. We also tried these clear toenail covers. I really like these boots, they are really well made. It is important to measure you dogs foot though, I assumed he’d be the largest size but they’re kind of big. They work well though, I just took off a star because they are expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Kailee A.

customer_reviews.title: Great, durable shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like the Vibram soles. Any other brand of dog shoes we've purchased in the past, have worn through the soles in no time due to friction. My last dog did wear through the fabric upper portion of his Ruffwear shoes with his toe nails but I was able to repair them. Other than that, after a small period of acclimating to them, my current dog seems to walk effortlessly in these shoes. They are a necessity for walking in the desert here in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: P. J. L.

customer_reviews.title: Petite Lab
customer_reviews.text: We have a 60lb black lab and she has tiny paws. When we measured her paws, we bought the ones that they said to. However, after trying them on her and going for a run on our gravel road, we could have went down a size. She took off after a few deer, and lost one of the boots right away. We did get it back, wish the reflective strip where on all sides, but then we still could have went the size down. Good Buy otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Cheynne M.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing boots- sizing can be challenging!
customer_reviews.text: I did a LOT of research before buying these for my service dog- I needed something for the New England seasons, from hot tar, to hiking in the fall, to possibly frigid ice winters for traction and these cover them all. The only thing I found difficult was sizing. I ordered the size after printing out the template and measuring multiple times and I'm still not sure if they are snug enough? I had a few issues with adjusting the Velcro tight enough around her paws but overall they work well.
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Lynn

customer_reviews.title: They work like a dream
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my 75 lb. Boxer/Pit mix who tore his paw pad open. He needed only one to prevent his paw from getting re-injured whenever he went outside. They work like a dream! He has no issue putting it on or walking around it in, and I know that it will last forever, especially since the sole is made with Vibram, which is used in Merrell hiking shoes. We did buy some socks (kids socks, not dog ones) to use underneath it, since it seemed that his ankle had some friction issues, but he can use the boot without it. These will definitely come in handy during the cold Midwest winters as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: The back paws work fine, the front paws the trex were too short
customer_reviews.text: German Shepard, The back paws work fine, the front paws the trex were too short. So when you put them on correctly the Dew claw would pull out from the shoe and rub raw. After two days of working with them my Shepard's due claws were bleeding and she did not want to put them on. Contacted the company who explained that I would have to use the one that had the sock and not the grip trex. My Shepard hates socks on her paws so..
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Not sure my dog can wear these.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes look great and appear to be sturdy. Walking was a bit rough for him. He appeared to overheat and was panting to the point of concern. When I took them off his paws were covered in sweat. I put them on a second time and the same thing happened. The moment I took them off, he was back to normal and able to run. As of right now running in the shoes is completely out of the question. My dog and I run about 20 miles a week. I wanted the shoes to protect his feet. I will continue to try and introduce the shoes to my dog, but so far I don't think it's going to work.
customer_reviews.author: D Price

customer_reviews.title: Best shoes out there
customer_reviews.text: My dog is a therapy dog and I needed a way to protect her feet in these southern. California heat. Inhave purchased tons of shoes these are the only ones that have stayed on. Especially since she is a tri-pod. I started with her using the two shoes in the front for a few hrs. A day then had her practice the rear leg. Then combined them. She walked a little funny for a few minutes then she was off and running.
customer_reviews.author: Fiorela

customer_reviews.title: Misadvertisement!
customer_reviews.text: Only received 2 of the 4 boots. I’m very diapointed because I checked to make sure I would get all 4.
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo

customer_reviews.title: These ran large for us.
customer_reviews.text: I really want to like this product because our dog needs boots. The grip on these boots is so much better than the previous boots he was wearing. His previous boots lasted about a year but after wearing them almost every day, the grip was worn down. These boots run big and are more difficult to fit on him. I bought the socks, too. They weren't very helpful as they just slid down in the show and rubbed on his paw.
customer_reviews.author: Mallory Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Great quality but boots don't stay up
customer_reviews.text: I measured my dog's foot according to the printout and ordered 2 pairs of different sizes due to my Beagle's paws being larger in front. The front were too loose and I returned for next smaller size. Booties still slid down and did not stay up snug on his paw. Bought the recommended socks from a local pet store and still no improvement. My dog would trip over the boot. I'm disappointed as the cost is high and the quality good (the soles have great traction and are protective) but they're not functional. I would NOT recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jami

customer_reviews.title: I bought these for my 2 year old german shephard ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 2 year old german shephard. Durring the summer last year the pads on his feet got torn up and he could hardly walk for a week two different times. He seems to walk normal with them now. And hopefully will go on protecting his paws from the hot wet ground
customer_reviews.author: Nick Turner

customer_reviews.title: Not sure
customer_reviews.text: They caused her paws to bleed, if she wore them more than 40 minutes. They rubbed the hair & skin off the top & side of her left paw. We got them because my son recommended them, we have the same breed of dog, and our poor girl got a thorn in her paw that wasn’t healing. Debris and little stones kept getting in the small hole caused by the thorn. The boots did help with that and she healed
customer_reviews.author: Spinning G

customer_reviews.title: My Greek Rescue Brittany Loves his boots!!
customer_reviews.text: My Greek Rescue Brittany does great in these boots! I think he loves them & the fact he can traverse over anything and his paw pads are protected is a Plus! He loves the great tread traction too!! They fit great & never even have to adjust! Get the socks! They help the boots slide on! They get a little sand in them but I like that they “breathe”!
customer_reviews.author: AZHIKER61

customer_reviews.title: Bad for dew claws
customer_reviews.text: These shoes closure is right where the dew claw is. They caused horrible sores that took weeks to heal. The shoe it's self is sturdy and easy to put on and take off. However if your dog has dew claws beware!
customer_reviews.author: BIRDY

customer_reviews.title: Comfy for canines, protects little paws
customer_reviews.text: Just got these for hiking with my dog. The mountains near here are great for hiking, but several friends have described how hard the trails are on doggy feet. We had the pupper try these on, and after a few minutes of high-stepping, got used to them and even seems to prefer ball chasing with them. I'll revisit this review if they don't last on the next few hikes, though I wore a vibram soled pair of boots in the oilfields and they lasted
customer_reviews.author: PaintswithWords

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: These shoes have helped my Golden get up when on hardwood floors without sliding and falling down. He has some arthritis in his back legs and we are thankful that these shoes give him the stability he needs in getting up and running around without falling.
customer_reviews.author: dsander

customer_reviews.title: Best booties by far
customer_reviews.text: The Ruffwear Griptex are the 4th different booties I have purchased. They are by far the best. I have a 95 lb. chocolate lab/husky mix. I ordered size 3.0. We live in the country on a gravel road, these booties save his paws from cuts. I use children socks to keep the gravel out and his dew claw from rubbing. Other booties I have purchased have worn thru just aft of the sole because they are round. These booties have rubber soles that are elongated, so they don't wear. Others I have purchased twist on his paws these don't. These booties cost more $37 for 2 but are well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: June K. Morrison

customer_reviews.title: Great quality shoes
customer_reviews.text: I like these shoes. The only draw back is they are kind of difficult to keep on a fluffy doodle because their paws tend to be a bit more narrow than most dogs. If you want to have an easier time getting your dog to keep theirs on measure their front and back paws and perhaps buy 2 and 2 that are sized for any difference. Other than that no complaints. This is a well made product.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Problem solved - 17 year old boxer/lab mix can finally walk on tile floors without falling
customer_reviews.text: These have been a tremendous help to my 17 year old boxer/lab mix. She can finally walk without sliding on my tile floors. I use them everyday. The only issue is the fabric is coming apart on the top and rubber is separating at the seam, but that could be because she wears them so often. But, when they do come apart will just buy another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny Alberty

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: The product was good. Unfortunatley, my Lab has what I call a snaggle toe. Meaning the middle toe is broken and does not curl, it sticks up like his is constantly flipping someone off. due to his snaggletoe, the boots did not fit quite right on the one paw. That said, the first time I put them on, he was high stepping and not enjoying them at all, as any dog would react. The second and third time I put the boots on, the boy would not move at all. He was laying down and would not move for 20 minutes, until I removed the boots. For that reason, I had to send them back.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer R

customer_reviews.title: Best all weather boots!...Comfortable, Breathable & Comfortable, Breathable, All weather boots.
customer_reviews.text: BEST BOOTS FOR HOT PAVEMENT, ASPHALT, ROCKY TERRAIN and RUNNING REAL FAST TO SHOW OFF! Once Macree caught on that he could run much faster in his tire tread boots he has been Zooming ever sense. MACREE APPROVES! Further good boots are essential in our TX heat and torrential rains. When the snow comes they stand up too. As aside: Macree & I have also noticed that he gets more compliments on his boots now than did his amazing coat & good looks.
customer_reviews.author: JP

customer_reviews.title: They work!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these after they were recommended by my Vet. Our senior Springer has weak back legs so he slides and falls on the wood floors. He has a lot of trouble getting up as well. These booties stay on and give him the traction he needs! He’s not falling anymore and it’s great. He did high step for a bit after I put them on, but now he’s walking normally. Finally something that works and stays on!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Sizes diff pretty drastic between 1.75-2.0
customer_reviews.text: These boots seem high quality. I will be updating after I take my dog out into the desert a few times. They are a little stiff at first but just taking my dog out once seemed to start to wear them in. Only issue I can see is that the sizes size up dramatically. One is 1.75 (back feet) 2.0 (fromt feet) As you can see in the photo, the size difference is drastic so I can see finding the right size to be tough. We originally bought 4 1.75s but they were a little tight on fronts so sized up 1 size
customer_reviews.author: Audieliz

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my Service Dog
customer_reviews.text: Amazing boots. I have a very active service dog and we live in NY where you can experience all 4 seasons in 1 day sometimes. They have been great for summer wear and I know they will be good for when the snow comes. Also have a sole with traction for walking on the ice too. Haven't had any problems like i did with cheaper boots with her dew claw. I would buy another pair in a heartbeat just wish they came in a hot pink color!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L.

customer_reviews.title: pqowerinaefd
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pair we have purchased. The first pair we bought at the vet, but they were a little more expensive there. We use these to protect our Golden's paws from foxtails in the spring. They serve that purpose. One drawback-costing the boots one star, is they are a bit of a pain to put on, and occasionally he will throw a shoe. Fortunately, we have always been able to find the missing shoe.
customer_reviews.author: baseballsensei

customer_reviews.title: All I can say is that I love them! They fit perfectly and stay on pretty ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my Australian Shepherd so he could go on the sand dunes with me. All I can say is that I love them! They fit perfectly and stay on pretty well. There is a little adjusting to do but they didn't come off once. I also got many compliments on them, saying I'm a good pet parent for looking out for my pup. So for any of you that are worried that they won't work on sand, they do! The only hassle is that the sand gets in them so they can be a little messy to clean up but definately worth it if you're considering lots of outdoor trekking with your fuzzy buddy.
customer_reviews.author: Masha Yi

customer_reviews.title: They are awesome but if your dog has dew claws I wouldn't recommend.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my dog and she was running like I have never seen her run before! A whole new confidence came over her, seriously it was crazy. The only problem I had was that her dew claws got very irritated with them so I boxed them up until I have time to get them removed. She is kinda bummed that I haven't put them on her since but soon she will get to run wild again.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler the buyer.

customer_reviews.title: So great!
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with these boots! I have purchased other boots in the past, for a much cheaper price, and they were horrible. So far these have exceeded my expectations and stay on nicely! My Aussie doesn't seem to mind them either. I would absolutely order them again (and most likely will for my other dog!) and I will recommend them to my friends and family. Thanks!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don’t wear as well as most items made by this company
customer_reviews.text: I have been using products made by Ruff wear for a long time and it is great well made and long wearing- except for these shoes! They are expensive and the tips wear out after only a few walks of the dog - for the money they are not a good deal! There are many other shoes out there that are cheaper and wear better! Sorry Ruff Wear you made a pretty shoe but it needs better materials!
customer_reviews.author: cedortch

customer_reviews.title: Great boots but should buy the socks too
customer_reviews.text: Pro: I love the construction of the boot. Our dog didn't have any troubles walking or running in them. Cons: boots can come loose if not placed on correctly. If your dog has their dew claws the boots rub and makes it uncomfortable for them to wear. So I am buying the socks to see if it helps.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Great protection
customer_reviews.text: These are great my dogs paws are protected and he looks so cute in them. I got them to protect his paws but I’m in love with how they look on him. Also you have the added humor of your dogs first steps in pup shoes to look forward to. Make sure to grab your camera and take a video.
customer_reviews.author: Damselflies

customer_reviews.title: These boots stay on, but can be irritating
customer_reviews.text: After trying other inexpensive brands that constantly slid or fell off entirely, I was willing to pay for quality. And fortunately these boots are worth the money, they stay on great! I measured my dog's paws as 3 inches across, but I went ahead and ordered a size down, 2.75 inches. I think the snug fit helps the boots stay on. My dog doesn't have dewclaws, but I can see how dogs with dewclaws can get pretty irritated or even bloody. I will be buying the accompanying socks for these boots because when my dog runs hard, his legs look slightly red around the friction area when I take the boots off (but he doesn't seem to care).
customer_reviews.author: Sofia Y.

customer_reviews.title: Ruffwear shoes provide comfort during wound care!
customer_reviews.text: Thank you for your prompt shipment to my friend’s home during our visit. These extra large shoes are being used to cover the large bandage and to cushion my senior golden retriever’s paw as she battles a malignant melanoma tumor on her paw pad. She is walking with more comfort now and for that we are so thankful. The Ruffwear shoes she has worn for years on long walks over rugged terrain no longer fit over her bandage.
customer_reviews.author: BJH

customer_reviews.title: Get sets of 2, not 4!
customer_reviews.text: Great boots! Well made, work great for long periods of time, and fit true to size. I recommended getting 2 different sets- 1 that fits front feet and 1 that fits back feet. I ordered the 1 set of four boots, all in one size. His front feet were 2.25 and his back were 2, so I thought if I just got the 2.25s, it would be okay. Unfortunately, they were just too big for the back feet, and one came off and got lost on the beach.
customer_reviews.author: Lexi Lofland

customer_reviews.title: Good but a bit too short.
customer_reviews.text: These felt more durable than their other style of shoes. Durability in terms of wear and tear and things that he might step on. However it felt a bit too stiff for him to walk around properly in them and a little shorter which I felt would interfere with the comfort for him.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: Best doggy shoes ever!
customer_reviews.text: These doggy shoes are by far the absolute very best. My dog walks super comfortably on them, he can take long walks on the city, jump, run, he gets compliments everywhere and the best of all, he doesn’t bring the city’s dirtiness/rain rain inside our home. Compared to other bootie styles, these are so far waterproof and the easiest to put on. Buying a second pair to have in case we need it.
customer_reviews.author: Lors

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality!
customer_reviews.text: We've been through a few brands of doggie boots, and these have been the best quality thus far. My pup, Hazel, is a tripod, which means she hops and shuffles more than most, which puts excess strain on the boots and makes it super important they don't slide off easily. The only drawback is that the top of the boot rubs directly on her front dewclaw, so we put tape on that foot before putting the boot on now. Living in Nevada, I'm quite happy with how well the boots stand up to the sandy and rocky terrain. 10/10 would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amelia U.

customer_reviews.title: Quality product!
customer_reviews.text: These have worked very well for our Senior dog who is having problems with his back legs. The shoes stay on tight and don’t twist. We use them so he does not slip on our wood floors and on short walks to protect the pads of his feet as he skifs when he walks
customer_reviews.author: Kelli Sweet

customer_reviews.title: Good hard soled boots.
customer_reviews.text: Good hard soled boots. Fit chart accurate. Prompt delivery. Need to guard against dew claw chafing and other rubbing. It seems to help to pad the Dew claw from the side of the foot and perhaps use socks. ( They are hard soled hiking boots ) The boots look cute and are reflective. The boots provide excellent cut protection.
customer_reviews.author: The Dog walker

customer_reviews.title: Too small to pass through
customer_reviews.text: Too small to pass through the paw and too big to be hept in place. The seem to be good quality product but until now my yellow lab won’t get used to them. We tried them at home but they are really hard to put on and they don’t stay on. The material is very stiff so it won’t stretch to put on easily. I’m going to keep trying, I hope with some use the material will become more flexible and comfortable for the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Forget it if you have a small dog.
customer_reviews.text: These boots are clearly great quality, but they were much too big for my 7 pound maltipoo. They were easy to put on, but fell off instantly even tightened as far as they would go. Plus her paw was swimming in the boot. Wish they would make boots for small dogs. The 1.5" is really suited to a Cavalier-sized dog.
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Amazing design!
customer_reviews.text: If it's the first time you put them on your best friend, he'll be a bit shy and a runaway horse, but later he will love them with its use. I recommend putting a sock inside the boot to protect your dogs paws, because if it is raining the paws may get wet. Perfect for snow and running Durable Functional True to size
customer_reviews.author: Luis Mejias

customer_reviews.title: Well made, very sturdy, but the sizing was really big.
customer_reviews.text: These are very well made, but I went by the instructions for measuring paw size and these were comically big for our dog. Like clown shoes. They are also very structured shoes so I'd say better for outdoors. Perfect for trails or hot pavement. I don't think our dog could have worn them all day, though, because didn't seem like they'd be comfortable when just laying around, even though she needs them for better grip on hard wood floors.
customer_reviews.author: Elle Won

customer_reviews.title: A new disabled doggie line needs be created
customer_reviews.text: I use for my impaired best friend. The tips wear out too quickly. Wish could get these with rubber bottom AND top.
customer_reviews.author: Juan C. Larach

customer_reviews.title: Not for dogs with dew claws
customer_reviews.text: So far they're sturdier than the cheaper brand I bought, but the velcro strap and collar land right on top of my dogs dew claws and rubs them raw. Gonna have to find a decent pair that run higher up her ankles/wrists. Well there's $75 down the drain.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyPTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Great exeriance
customer_reviews.text: I had a wonderful experience ordering this item for my dogs. I had purchased the wrong size and the return was quick and easy. I then reordered and they arrived in a timely manor. I LOVE the boots. My dog's did not have to acclimate long before they were comfortable to wear. I watched videos from Ruffwear before I purchased them so I know how to make putting them on a good experience for my dogs. Ruffwear also made it so easy to select the right type of shoe and how to select the correct size shoe with their videos. After ordering them they arrived in a timely manor.
customer_reviews.author: nicole Brett

customer_reviews.title: Couldn’t keep some on straight
customer_reviews.text: The shoes worked great , My German Shepard is older and dragging her back paws when she walks and the shoes protected her feet well. Unfortunately her right rear foot shoe kept spinning around so she walked on the top of the shoe and it never rotated back. She wore a hole in the top of her shoe and they had to be replaced. The left rear foot is perfect and did an awesome job. I attempted to snug the shoe but it didn’t help. SO, if the shoes don’t rotate and the dog walks on the tread rather than the tops of the shoe they are perfect. . Otherwise they wore out in 3 weeks.
customer_reviews.author: James D. Cardinale

customer_reviews.title: Worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to help with the treatment and healing of an injured paw. While they do cost more than others, they are definitely worth it. I had purchased a lesser prices pair before, they didn’t last and they were not as sturdy. These have been worth the extra money and have really helped our dog.
customer_reviews.author: Ramon S.

customer_reviews.title: But I made sure to make them nice and tight
customer_reviews.text: I lost a shoe after the first run with the boy. Granted he runs 30 miles an hour and is 100 lbs. But I made sure to make them nice and tight. I think a small lace system would work better than the velcro
customer_reviews.author: emmerson

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my pup
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my dog when we moved to Phoenix to protect his paws from the hot pavement. It made all the difference. The only flaw is that they seem to rub on the top of his paws when he wears them for a long time. It took him a few times wearing them to get used to them, but otherwise they didn’t seem to bother him.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great boots!
customer_reviews.text: These boots are great. They are easy to put on, my dog doesn’t resist wearing them. They stood up to snow, ice, dirt, mud, gravel, and pavement. My dog has problems with one of his feet and if it is bothering him he will lick and chew on the mesh on the top of the boot; eventually he would make a hole in it, but the mesh was tough and it took time for him to break through. I highly recommend these boots.
customer_reviews.author: Juju F.

customer_reviews.title: Fit
customer_reviews.text: My four-legged child could not walk in these. They do not have a "constructed" bend in them, so she was walking on her toes like a ballerina. If they had a built-in bend, a dog could walk on their paws.
customer_reviews.author: Sara

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: Got these for my working K9. Went to put them on and thought that one seemed a little larger than the others, but ignored it. Every time we worked with them in he would have one that would spin upside down. Needless to say my malinois has destroyed that one. Decided to measure the soles of them all to see if it really was bigger. Turns out one shoe is over 1/4" larger than the rest, hence the fitment issues. Other than this ive been pretty satisfied with the durability considering the intensity of my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew L.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing.
customer_reviews.text: Given as a gift to a breed rescue for a dog that's recuperating from spinal surgery. Is regaining mobility in her hind limbs and drags one foot about every 3rd step. Gift recipient reports that the boot had a hole on it after one single 15 minute walk. Take from that what you may. Arrived quickly, and apparently packaged well.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Sumrow

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: High end boots. If you’re looking for boots this is the way to go. They are breathable (we use them for the summer in AZ), and comfortable. Our pup has dew claws and we use socks, he hasn’t had an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina Caldwell

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit, comfortable, excellent quality, so far durable. Just perfect!!
customer_reviews.text: My mini-schnauzer 20 pounds found comfort and protection for his paws. Good quality and x-small size fits perfect for him. If you tide it well, it won’t lose. It is just as described. I would buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jan

customer_reviews.title: We use them daily since we have received them and they are amazing! No more feet washes to get the allergens ...
customer_reviews.text: Our pup is 91 lbs of GSD and active is an understatement but these boot really do the trick. We use them daily since we have received them and they are amazing! No more feet washes to get the allergens off his feet after walk or playing in the snow. He doesn't slide slippery floors even if they are wet which is shocking! We just love these boots and are so happy we made the investment for our pup:)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable as ever
customer_reviews.text: Love ruffwear and the products they make they last forever. These are so easy to slip onto my dogs foot and they never fall off. Only issue is sometimes they can spin around so keep a eye on that so your dog is walking on the padded portion but we love these shoes work great for all weather snow and hot ground.
customer_reviews.author: AD

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good shoes but have issue with rubbing on the few claws, had to wrap my dogs feet before putting these one so her paws wouldn't hurt after but otherwise they are really good
customer_reviews.author: robyn

customer_reviews.title: They don't twist around like the cheap brands
customer_reviews.text: Invest in these for your dog! They don't twist around like the cheap brands, they are snug and secure and provide great traction for my pup.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: These shoes fit my dog really nicely and look great but I've had them for less than two years and only used them about 10-15 times so far and two of them already have large holes in them. I paid more for these shoes for my dog than pretty much all of my own shoes, and for $80 bucks for such tiny shoes I'd expect them to last a lot longer
customer_reviews.author: Ian Meyer

customer_reviews.title: CAUSED SORES - RETURNED THEM
customer_reviews.text: We used these about four times on our dog. We measured his paws and ordered based on the size chart suggestion. They seemed to fit well and didn't seem too tight or bothersome. After our last walk, we found these sores on his two front paws. We have returned these shoes. Please use caution when ordering for your pup!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I love these shoes for my dog
customer_reviews.text: I love these shoes for my dog! they work great and are easy to put on. i also have the ruffwear socks and love those too. The only thing I wasn't to happy about is where the toe (grey part) meets the black, they always come undone right there. which makes me buy these shoes every couple months. i would think for the price they would last lot longer
customer_reviews.author: ava heckathorn

customer_reviews.title: Love Them
customer_reviews.text: Took a little getting used to for my two dogs - but after a gentle walk around room, a walk and then short run - my dogs were running fine. Easy on/off and secure. My dogs have declaws - no troubles - shoes went right over
customer_reviews.author: Casy

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended in snow or mud!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in these boots. I measured and bought correct sizes per manufacturer specifications but they do not stay on very well. I have tightened them as tight as I can without causing discomfort and they still get pulled off in the snow. I would not recommend these boots if you are planning on your dog wearing them in ANY amount of snow or mud. High quality materials just doesn’t serve the purpose I need them for.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DISHONEST RETURN AND REFUND!!!
customer_reviews.text: What about your return policy? I bought 4 boots, but I decided to return them because my dog was in pain and showed discomfort. These boots are practically new, I only let her try for few days and returned after a week I got them. I paid almost $80. I wish I am misunderstanding that you want to reimburse me $0.01. I would appreciate your help.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great paw protection
customer_reviews.text: Took a while to break in and get the tightness of the velcro right. Huge help on frigid winters days in snow, ice and salt. Easy on and off.
customer_reviews.author: EH

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and Stylish
customer_reviews.text: Got them for my service dog working during hot the Alabama summer. I know there are many others that are cheaper but I preferred the look of sturdy, well fitting shoes. The inside is not padded so I do not know how comfortable they are for him to wear but he can wear them for hours at a time without batting an eye. He happily stands while I pick up his feet to put them on.
customer_reviews.author: Molly Pierce

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, worth the extra money
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased multiple pairs of shoes for my German Shepherd. He is suffering from DM and drags his rear feet. These have held up well, and give him grip on slippery floors
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best dog booties for my disabled dog
customer_reviews.text: I actually got these for my Chesapeake Bay Retriever who is suffering from a degenerative spinal cord problem, which means her back legs aren't working. I purchased booties from the pet store that had grip on the bottom to help her with her balance and protect her paws when they drag. They kept falling off. I tried to rig my own pair but that didn't work. These Ruffies are perfect. THE VELCRO is the BEST. The bottoms are truly grippy and let her walk more easily.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dog boots
customer_reviews.text: They stayed on great for 5 daily one mile walks. Then kept coming off. Very easy to put on. Not sure how well they’d stay on for young, active dog walking.
customer_reviews.author: PKSreviewer

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: Unsure why there are negative reviews. My dog likes them a lot. Also, I think they might be too narrow if you have a dog with dew claws. Mine doesn’t, so his foot fit fine.
customer_reviews.author: Rachael Mallory

customer_reviews.title: The only one that fits and STAYS PUT
customer_reviews.text: My buddy got used to these quick, they fit perfect and really stays in place. Even through obstical course training. I would say, go to their website, print the measurement guide, if your pups paw measures between sizes, go down one full size.
customer_reviews.author: michael smith

customer_reviews.title: Had a product that were great for rain but not hot climates
customer_reviews.text: This is a outstanding product. Had a product that were great for rain but not hot climates. Sometimes it get in the hundreds so you know the pavement is smoking hot. She’s has them on from the house to our destination take them off inside with easy and put them back on until we get back home. Great product highly recomended. Thanks Ruffwear😍
customer_reviews.author: MEC

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: I spent more on these shoes than I do on my own, but I live in Tucson and needed something that protect my dog’s paws during the summer months. I’m very pleased with the fit. They do not fall off and have a good amount of the think rubber on the bottom. I’m very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: V. Martin

customer_reviews.title: So far so good!
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! She wears them and seems ok. We’ve gotten a lot of compliments on them when out. I’m just happy she cant get them off and wears them! Seems to wear right.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed for my service dog during the hot Texas summers
customer_reviews.text: Great boots. My female German Shepherd wears a size 3 on all four feet (even though her back paws are smaller 2.75 inches) I’ve had no problems at all. I do recommend getting socks though for dew claw protection. I hope she has these boot for a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey B

customer_reviews.title: does what i need for foot protection.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because our aging dog is dragging one rear foot. This does protect from abrasion which was the point. next time I will buy the color red because when he loses the boot it is hard to find, specially since we have a horse and there are lots of dark objects on the ground.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not rugged
customer_reviews.text: Cute in theory. Took my dog a few hours to get used to them. After the adjustment we took a backpacking trip and he lost 2 of them on the trail in the first 20 minutes.. another spun around his foot in the opposite direction. I could see how they would be good for an average walk around but if you are looking for something more rugged time on the trail and calluses.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Durable and size matters..
customer_reviews.text: Our dog is very active. This product has held up extremely well, and does not turn on his foot. This product is more expensive than other brands we’ve tried, but we have never had to replace our original purchase..With regard to size, our original purchase was 2.25 which we use on the front paws and have since bought 2.00 for the back paws.
customer_reviews.author: RockinRon

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Good fit, not sure there's anything to improve. They're pricey, but I found these based on the military using them for their dogs, enough said. You can buy them in pairs of 2 to fit different sizes front and back.
customer_reviews.author: Old Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Protection
customer_reviews.text: I got these to protect his feet from hot pavement. As a vet tech it’s something I think about & heatstroke. I’m lucky he didn’t mind them on his feet!
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Roberts

product_meta.title: RUFFWEAR, Grip Trex Outdoor Dog Boots with Rubber Soles for Hiking and Running
feature_bullets: TRAIL-READY BOOTS: Protect their paws from whatever the trail throws at you; These boots are ideal for backpacking, hiking, mountain biking, trail running, and any other outdoor adventures
RUGGED OUTSOLE: Vibram non-marking outsoles with rugged lug design give them traction and flexibility so they can tackle any terrain without breaking their stride
BREATHABLE MESH: Made with tightly woven air mesh that keeps dirt and debris out while staying comfortable and ventilated all day long
SECURE FIT: Designed with a wide opening that makes it easy to put boots on; A reliable hook-and-loop cinch closure system ensures a snug, secure fit on all paws
REFLECTIVE TRIM: Low-light visibility with reflective trim to traverse the evenings and early mornings safely; For extra visibility, pair with reflective Ruffwear collars, leashes, and Beacon light

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
